What are the inputs and outputs for a forecast?
2.3 Endogenous vs. Exogenous
The input data can be further subdivided in order to better understand its relationship to
the output variable. An input variable is endogenous if it is aï¬€ected by other variables in
the system and the output variable depends on it. In a time series, the observations for an
input variable depend upon one another. For example, the observation at time t is dependent
